title: Wilwood Brakes for the Roadkill El Camino and Sand Casting Hot Rod Parts! - Hot Rod Garage Ep. 4

comments.text:
Oh and the red calipers are like 25 horsepower.. So it's faster, lighter 
and it stops better.. Why would you not do this mod!﻿
comments.author: NarschoolVlog

comments.text:
they have a camino and they have a ranchero so when are they going to get a 
rampage and drop something that could power a semi-truck in it.﻿
comments.author: christian jobes

comments.text:
Hey fellas I thought you might want to know that whom ever is doing your 
closed captioning does not seem to have a clue as to what your saying most 
of the time LOL.﻿
comments.author: Floyd Cordery

comments.text: Lol Lincoln tech tip " hey we have a plasma cutter" great tip!﻿
comments.author: Brian Fleming

comments.text:
Freiburger and Finnegan! I just watched the Q&A and realized you answered 
my question on the show! Thanks for the shout out and answering my 
question. I did get the fittings and used them on my 69 Charger build. Keep 
up the good work guys!﻿

almost half the ep? I dunno, I feel I got what I expected out of the 
earlier eps, now I'm just being sold to by a face I trust... Could this 
have been the plan all along?

Nice you guys could stick the Q&A at the end and that seems like just 
hanging out with the boys. Fun and all, but I'd say I expect such a thing 
from Roadkill.

At least Freiburger showed up finally.﻿

comments.author: Tom Jr

comments.text:
@ 23:15 he mentioned he put the form in a "lathe" ... Ha.., I happen to be 
a machinist. A lathe does not do this type of work. I'm pretty sure he 
means a "Mill" lathes the part spins making round cylindrical parts. The 
mill is the only machine that can make 3d movements in all 3 x,y, and z 
axis.﻿
